DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of treatment with a steroid and antibiotic on the size of the tonsils and symptoms of children with OSAS.
DOC.brief_title: Systemic Steroids Plus Antibiotics in Sleep Apnea Syndrome in Children
DOC.detailed_description: We will enroll children between 18 months and 12 years of age with mild sleep apnea and treat them with 5 days of prednisolone and 10 days of amoxicillin/clavulanate. We will obtain a questionnaire pre and post treatment and ask the parents to tell us if they think the child has improved enough after treatment to forego surgery. If not, they will undergo an adenotonsillectomy to relieve their sleep apnea and if yes, we will repeat the sleep study to make sure that the apnea has resolved.
DOC.criteria: Polysomnogram results showing mild obstructive sleep apnea. Significant medical problems Chronic medication intake (except bronchodilators and inhaled steroids) Allergy to penicillin or its derivatives.
DOC.keyword: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) in children
